channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: Why US-Bangladesh trade deal poses challenges for India
How smart glasses have become a tool for ‘manfluencers’ to secretly exploit women
Is Gen-Z less intelligent than millennials?
Ghislaine Maxwell pleaded the fifth before US Congress: What does it mean?
When should you text after a first date? What science reveals
Why the Bhumjaithai Party’s win signals a big shift in Thai politics
How Trump is pursuing America First in the Ukraine war and Iran crisis
item.description: On Ukraine, the US is keen to draw Russia away from China, while in Iran its focus has shifted from supporting protestors to military and nuclear issues, signalling that it does not anticipate a regime change in the near future

item.title: A big step in the right direction: Decoding the India-US interim trade deal
item.description: The India-US interim trade agreement is a significant, positive development in bilateral economic ties. Yet, the broader relationship remains subject to the unpredictable whims and transactional demands of the Trump administration

item.title: From Bangladesh to Nepal, US to Israel: Elections that New Delhi will be closely watching in 2026
item.description: From disputed ballots and snap elections to historic landslides and democratic pushback against extremism, 2026 is shaping up as a year of political reckoning

item.title: Japan: Sanae Takaichi secures a historic mandate, but uphill challenges lie ahead
item.description: Although Takaichi may enjoy the proverbial political honeymoon phase for a while, in the longer term, she has to do a lot of balancing acts in ensuring her popular base while steering the country forward amidst regional and global tumult and geopolitical unpredictability

item.title: PM Modi's Malaysia visit: A diplomatic catch-up or a strategic reset?
item.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s stand-alone visit to Malaysia remains a careful step toward keeping doors open in an increasingly contested Indo-Pacific

item.title: Operation Herof 2.0: Pakistan is a pawn in the new Great Game in Balochistan
item.description: Operation Herof 2.0 may ultimately be remembered as the moment when Pakistan failed to realise that it is no longer the kingmaker playing the Great Game but a pawn in the hands of great powers getting played in the very same game
